theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Programmed Longevity and Aging Regulation Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: This theory focuses on genetic programming and regulation of aging via daf and age genes, fitting the genetic control and programmed aging theme.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Programmed Longevity and Aging Regulation Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes genetic variability and intrinsic genetic programming of lifespan, aligning with genetic control of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Programmed Longevity and Aging Regulation Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on single longevity genes and genetic control of aging, fitting the genetic programming subcluster.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Links developmental programming and growth rate to aging, fitting programmed genetic regulation of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Programmed Longevity and Aging Regulation Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details daf-2/daf-16 genetic pathway controlling lifespan, a core genetic programmed aging mechanism.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on conserved genetic pathways underlying aging and age-related diseases, fitting genetic programmed aging.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes rare genetic variants in conserved aging pathways linked to longevity, consistent with genetic programming.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Programmed Longevity and Aging Regulation Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights conserved transcription factors as central genetic regulators of aging, fitting genetic programming theme.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nutrient-Sensing and Growth Factor Signaling Longevity Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on nutrient sensing pathways (IIS, TOR, sirtuins) regulating aging, a key metabolic and growth factor signaling mechanism.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes caloric restriction and nutrient sensing pathways (mTOR, AMPK, IIS) modulating aging, fitting nutrient sensing subcluster.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on GH/IGF-I and nutrient signaling pathways modulating aging and lifespan, fitting growth factor and nutrient sensing theme.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes GH deficiency/resistance extending lifespan via multiple aging-related pathways, fitting growth factor signaling.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Details age-related decline in GH/IGF-1 and its systemic aging effects, fitting growth factor signaling subcluster.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on elastin longevity, damage accumulation, and limited repair, representing a structural protein aging mechanism.
